text.0: bring forth your song of praise to mighty agni the speedy messenger of earth and heaven.
text.1: vaiśvānara who with those who wake hath waxen great in the lap of all the gods immortal.
text.2: sought in the heavens on earth is agni stablished leader of rivers bull of standing waters.
text.3: vaiśvānara when he hath grown in glory shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.
text.4: for fear of thee forth fled the darkhued races scattered abroad deserting their possessions.
text.5: when glowing o vaiśvānara for pūru thou agni didst light up and rend their castles.
text.6: agni vaiśvānara both earth and heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction.
text.7: refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.
text.8: agni the tawny horses loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil attend thee.
text.9: lord of the tribes our charioteer of riches ensign of days vaiśvānara of mornings.
text.10: in thee o bright as mitra vasus seated the might of aduras for they loved thy spirit.
text.11: thou dravest dasyus from their home o agni and broughtest forth broad light to light the Ārya.
text.12: born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest like wind the place where gods inhabit.
text.13: thou favouring thine offspring roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures jātavedas.
text.14: send us that strength vaiśvānara send it agni that strength o jātavedas full of splendour.
text.15: wherewith allbounteous god thou pourest riches as fame widespreading on the man who offers.
text.16: agni bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power that wealth which feedeth many.
text.17: accordant with the vasus and the rudras agni vaiśvānara give us sure protection.
